title: Mass. men sentenced to prison for mail theft, check fraud scheme
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Imanol Rios-Franco, 26, sentenced to 35 months; Brandon Baez, 23, sentenced to two years for mail theft and fraud.
From June 2023 to February 2024, they stole checks from USPS boxes, washed ink, and reissued them to controlled accounts.
Rios-Franco ordered to pay $12,528; Baez $10,285 in restitution; investigators found cellphone evidence of their scheme.

title: Milford teen detained by ICE last year invited to State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Milford teen Marcelo Gomes da Silva invited to the State of the Union by Rep. Seth Moulton after ICE detention.
Gomes was detained by ICE in May 2025 while driving his father's car, despite having no criminal record.
Gomes experienced poor conditions at a Burlington ICE facility, sparking community protests and calls for immigration reform.

title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed a center-ice goal in Team USA's win over Denmark in Olympic hockey.
Swayman humorously attributed his inability to see the puck to being colorblind, despite speculation about black boards.
Team USA outpaced Denmark with strong offense; Swayman might only make one Olympic start against fellow goalies.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jayson Tatum nears return from Achilles injury, missing All-Star weekend for the first time in six years.
Kevin Durant, who overcame a similar injury, expects Tatum to regain All-Star-level play upon return.
Carmelo Anthony notes Tatum's return could strengthen Celtics, posing a threat to other NBA teams.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots have approximately $41 million in cap space for the 2026 offseason.
Wide receiver Alec Pierce, previously with the Colts, recorded 1,003 yards and 6 touchdowns in 2025.
Offensive tackle Rasheed Walker, formerly with the Packers, is a top free agent despite a drop in performance last season.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN Unlimited subscribers can add MLB.TV for $134.99 per season; it's not included in their plan.
Non-subscribers can purchase MLB.TV for $149.99 and receive one free month of ESPN Unlimited.
Existing MLB.TV users can renew automatically and link their subscriptions to ESPN's app.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a practice with the Maine Celtics, raising speculation about his possible season return.
Ron Harper Jr. reported Tatum looked like his usual self during the G League practice but gave no return timeline.
Celtics' Brad Stevens emphasized Tatum will not play until fully ready, with no current change in his injury status.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in the US according to WalletHub's 2026 analysis.
Over 47% of Massachusetts adults hold a bachelor's degree, the highest percentage nationally, with nearly 22% holding advanced degrees.
Vermont and Maryland followed Massachusetts, while Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia ranked last in educational attainment.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction â€” and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: A rare T206 Honus Wagner baseball card, tied to Massachusetts, is up for auction, closing February 21.
The card was originally obtained by Morton Bernstein, whose family owned a silver plant in Taunton, MA.
The card is ungraded and has a current auction bid of $3.9 million with a potential final price over $4.75 million.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jeremy Swayman will start in goal for Team USA against Denmark at the 2026 Winter Olympics, making his Olympic debut.
Swayman played a key role in USA's 2025 IIHF World Championship win, going 5-0 with a shutout in the final.
Swayman has a 2025-26 NHL record of 22-12-3 with a 2.92 GAA and a .903 save percentage for the Bruins.
